summary: The document is a memorandum from FBI Director Clarence M. Kelley to Ms. Jeanne W. Davis, Staff Secretary of the National Security Council, dated June 7, 1976. It addresses a request from the Senate Select Committee (SSC) for documents related to the LBJ Library, specifically those concerning the FBI. The memorandum outlines which documents can be provided to the SSC Staff, either directly or with redactions, and which are restricted to review on NSC premises due to their classification level. It includes a detailed list of documents, their classifications, and any necessary redactions.
key_findings: The FBI agreed to provide several documents to the SSC Staff, some with redactions, related to the assassination of President John F. Kennedy and other sensitive matters.
Certain documents were deemed too sensitive for delivery but could be reviewed on NSC premises, highlighting the high level of secrecy surrounding some aspects of the JFK assassination investigation.
The document underscores the ongoing interest and investigation into the JFK assassination by the Senate Select Committee in 1976, over a decade after the event.
